noteParagraph.text: In this class, the term "drilling" covers "boring" and vice versa.

titlePart.entryReference: making shafts, driving galleries or tunnels

titlePart.text: OBTAINING OIL, GAS, WATER, SOLUBLE OR MELTABLE MATERIALS FROM DEEP WELLS
Devices for reversing the movement of the rod or cable at the surface
Adaptation of rotary draw works to drive rotary tables
titlePart.entryReference: connecting or disconnecting couplings or joints
rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms, capstans

titlePart.text: impact being obtained by gravity only, e.g. with lost-motion connection
continuous unidirectional rotary motion of shaft or drilling pipe effecting consecutive impacts
Plural down-hole drives, e.g. for combined percussion and rotary drilling
Drives for combined percussion and rotary drilling
Special methods or apparatus for drilling
Portable drilling rigs, truck- or skid-mounted, with their own drive
titlePart.entryReference: portable drilling rigs for use on underwater floors
derricks or masts specially adapted therefor

titlePart.text: Special apparatus for deflecting the boring, e.g. special drill bits, knuckle joints, whipstocks
titlePart.entryReference: deflecting the direction of fishing tools
derricks or masts specially adapted therefor

titlePart.text: with underwater tool drive prime mover, e.g. portable drilling rigs for use on underwater floors
from floating support with independent underwater anchored guide base
Drilling by use of heat, e.g. flame drilling
Applying separate balls or pellets by the pressure of the drill, so-called shot-drilling
Drilling by liquid or gas jets, with or without entrained pellets
Driving or forcing casings into boreholes, e.g. sinking

titlePart.entryReference: sinking shafts while moving the lining downwards

titlePart.text: Surface means for applying alternating rotation movements to the casing
Drilling using vibrating or oscillating means, e.g. out-of-balance masses
Drilling without earth removal, e.g. with self-propelled burrowing devices

titlePart.entryReference: drill bits for enlarging the borehole
specially adapted for deflecting the direction of boring

titlePart.text: with roller axle supported at both ends
combined with non-rolling cutters other than of leading-portion type
characterised by tooth form or arrangement
characterised by conduits or nozzles for drilling fluids
characterised by detachable or adjustable parts, e.g. legs or axles
characterised by bearing or lubricating details
Drill bits with leading portion, i.e. drill bits with a pilot cutter
Drill bits for enlarging the borehole, e.g. reamers
titlePart.entryReference: percussion drill bits with leading portion

titlePart.text: Longitudinal axis roller reamers, e.g. reamer stabilizers
characterised by conduits or nozzles for drilling fluids
Fork type rotary drill bits, e.g. fish tail bits with detachable blades
Bits with helical conveying portion, e.g. screw type bits
Augers with leading portion or with detachable parts
characterised by wear resisting parts, e.g. diamond inserts
the bit being of core type
the bit being of roller type
with chisel or button type inserts
the bit being of fork type
characterised by conduits or nozzles for drilling fluids
characterised by parts or cutting elements which are detachable or adjustable
titlePart.entryReference: for fork type rotary drill bits

titlePart.text: characterised by the whole or part thereof being insertable into or removable from the borehole without withdrawing the drilling pipe
the cutting element being movable through the drilling pipe and laterally shiftable

titlePart.entryReference: percussion drives used in the borehole

titlePart.text: with driven cutting chains or similarly-driven tools
Other equipment or details for drilling
specially adapted for directional drilling, e.g. slant hole rigs

titlePart.entryReference: tubes or tube couplings in general

titlePart.text: between rod and bit, or between rod and rod
with ribs, pins, or jaws, and complementary grooves or the like, e.g. bayonet catches
Telescoping joints for varying drill string lengths

titlePart.entryReference: drives used in the borehole with anchoring means

titlePart.text: Devices for placing or drawing out wear protectors
Pipes provided with plural fluid passages
titlePart.entryReference: circulation of drilling fluid by means of such pipes

titlePart.text: Rods or pipes with helical structure
titlePart.entryReference: drill bits with helical conveying portion

titlePart.text: Handling rods, casings, tubes or the like outside of the borehole, e.g. in the derrick

titlePart.entryReference: load-engaging elements for hoisting or lowering purposes in general

titlePart.text: Elevators, i.e. rod- or tube-gripping devices
Apparatus for feeding the rods or cables
Apparatus for increasing or decreasing the pressure on the drilling tool
Apparatus for counterbalancing the weight of the rods
specially adapted for drilling underwater formations from a floating support using heave compensators supporting the drill string
Racks, ramps, troughs or bins, for holding the lengths of rod singly or connected
Handling between storage place and borehole
Racking of rods in horizontal position
Handling between horizontal and vertical position
Connecting or disconnecting pipe couplings or joints
Connecting or disconnecting drill bit and drilling pipe
Combined feeding from rack and connecting, e.g. automatically
Handling reeled pipe or rod units, e.g. flexible drilling pipes
Methods or apparatus for flushing boreholes
titlePart.entryReference: freeing objects stuck in boreholes by flushing
dust eliminating or removing in mining or quarrying

titlePart.text: Arrangements for treating drilling fluids above ground
titlePart.entryReference: treating steps per se, see the relevant sub-classes

titlePart.text: Controlling or monitoring pressure or flow of drilling fluid, e.g. automatic filling of boreholes, automatic control of bottom pressure
Valves arrangements in drilling fluid circulation systems
using drilling pipes with plural fluid passages, e.g. closed circulation systems
using liquid and gaseous fluids, e.g. foams
Apparatus for displacing, setting, locking, releasing or removing tools, packers or the like in boreholes or wells
titlePart.entryReference: setting of casings, screens, or liners

titlePart.text: for locking the tools or the like in landing nipples or in recesses between adjacent sections of tubing
for setting the tools into, or removing the tools from, laterally offset landing nipples or pockets
operated by fluid means, e.g. actuated by explosion
Introducing or running tools by fluid pressure, e.g. through-the-flow-line tool systems
Apparatus for obtaining or removing undisturbed cores, e.g. core barrels, core extractors
titlePart.entryReference: using explosives or projectiles in boreholes

titlePart.text: the core receiver being insertable into, or removable from, the borehole without withdrawing the drilling pipe
the core receiver having a core forming cutting edge or element, e.g. punch type core barrels
the core receiver having a flexible liner or inflatable retaining means
Recovering uncontaminated cores or cores at formation pressure
Formed core retaining or severing means
mounted on pivot transverse to core axis
the core receiver being specially adapted for operation under water
Cutting or destroying pipes, packers, plugs, or wire lines, located in boreholes or wells, e.g. cutting of damaged pipes, of windows
Deforming of pipes in boreholes or wells
Reconditioning of well casings while in the ground
by explosives or by thermal or chemical means
titlePart.entryReference: destroying objects in boreholes or wells by explosives

titlePart.text: Cutting of wire lines or the like
Cutting windows, e.g. directional window cutters for whipstock operations
Cutting or deforming pipes to control fluid flow
Reconditioning of well casings, e.g. straightening
Fishing for or freeing objects in boreholes or wells
titlePart.entryReference: provisions on well heads for introducing or removing objects
locating or determining the position of objects in boreholes or wells

titlePart.text: using junk baskets or the like
using impact means for releasing stuck parts, e.g. jars
Grappling tools, e.g. tongs or grabs
with means deflecting the direction of the tool, e.g. by use of knuckle joints
combined with cutting or destroying means
titlePart.entryReference: cutting or destroying means per se

titlePart.text: Sealing or packing boreholes or wells
Connectors used on well heads, e.g. for connecting blow-out preventer and riser
titlePart.entryReference: connecting a production flow line to an underwater well head

titlePart.text: Suspending casings or tubings in well heads
specially adapted for underwater well heads
Cementing-heads, e.g. having provision for introducing cementing plugs
specially adapted for underwater well heads
having provision for introducing objects or fluids into, or removing objects from, wells
Units with longitudinally-spaced plugs for isolating the intermediate space
with fluid-pressure-operated elastic cup or skirt
with a member expanded radially by axial pressure
with mechanical slips for hooking into the casing
Methods or devices for cementing, for plugging holes, crevices, or the like
using plugs for isolating cement charge
Valve arrangements for boreholes or wells
responsive to flow or pressure of the fluid obtained
operated by control fluid supplied from above ground
operated by movement of casings or tubings
operated by movement of tools, e.g. sleeve valves operated by pistons or wire line tools
Methods or apparatus for preventing or extinguishing fires
titlePart.entryReference: cutting or deforming pipes to control fluid flow
controlling flow of fluid to or in wells

titlePart.text: Heating, cooling, or insulating arrangements for boreholes or wells, e.g. for use in permafrost zones
Methods or apparatus for cleaning boreholes or wells
operated by fluid pressure, e.g. free-piston scrapers
titlePart.entryReference: operating other tools by fluid pressure

titlePart.text: using chemical means for preventing or limiting the deposition of paraffins or like substances
cleaning in situ of down-hole filters, screens, or gravel packs
Tubing catchers, automatically arresting the fall of oil-well tubing
Equipment or details not covered by groups
in situ inhibition of corrosion in boreholes or wells
Manipulators for underwater operations, e.g. temporarily connected to well heads
Work chambers for underwater operations, e.g. temporarily connected to well heads
Methods or apparatus for obtaining oil, gas, water, soluble or meltable materials from deep wells
titlePart.entryReference: obtaining oil-bearing deposits or soluble or meltable materials by mining techniques

titlePart.text: specially adapted for obtaining from underwater installations
Connecting a production flow line to an underwater well head
Production satellite stations, i.e. underwater installations comprising a plurality of satellite well heads connected to a central station
Setting of casings, screens or liners in wells
titlePart.entryReference: driving or forcing casings into boreholes, simultaneously drilling and casing boreholes
setting of tools, packers or the like

titlePart.text: Perforators with extendable perforating members, e.g. actuated by fluid means
Perforators using direct fluid action, e.g. abrasive jets
characterised by lowering in vertical position and subsequent tilting to operating position
Details, e.g. for locating perforating place or direction
Methods or apparatus for controlling the flow of the obtained fluid to or in wells
Secondary recovery methods for obtaining oil
Interconnecting two or more wells by fracturing or otherwise attacking the formation
Use of chemicals or bacterial activity
titlePart.entryReference: chemical features in extracting oils from oil sands or shales

titlePart.text: by use of eroding chemicals, e.g. acids
Specific pattern of wells, e.g. optimizing the spacing of wells
Preventing gas- or water-coning phenomena, i.e. the formation of a conical column of gas or water around wells
Arrangements for separating materials produced by the well
titlePart.entryReference: separating apparatus per se, see the relevant sub-classes

titlePart.text: Separation associated with re-injection of separated materials

Automatic control systems specially adapted for drilling operations, i.e. self-operating systems which function to carry out or modify a drilling operation without intervention of a human operator, e.g. computer-controlled drilling systems
titlePart.entryReference: for non-automatic drilling control, see the operation controlled
automatic feeding from rack and connecting of drilling pipes
controlling pressure or flow of drilling fluid

titlePart.text: Systems specially adapted for monitoring a plurality of drilling variables or conditions
titlePart.entryReference: means for transmitting measuring-signals from the well to the surface

titlePart.text: Measuring the drilling time or rate of penetration

titlePart.entryReference: monitoring pressure or flow of drilling fluid

titlePart.text: Locating or determining the position of objects in boreholes or wells
Identifying the free or blocked portions of pipes
Locating fluid leaks, intrusions, or movements
Means for transmitting measuring-signals from the well to the surface, e.g. logging while drilling
Testing the nature of borehole walls
Methods or apparatus for obtaining samples of soil or well fluids, specially adapted to earth drilling or wells
by mechanically taking samples of the soil
titlePart.entryReference: investigation of foundation soil in situ

titlePart.text: using side-wall drilling tools or scrapers
Obtaining fluid samples or testing fluids, in boreholes or wells
using side-wall fluid samplers or testers
